name: E. Conveyor
statement:
There is a conveyor with 120 rows and 120 columns. Each row and column
is numbered from 0 to 119, and the cell in i-th row and j-th column is
denoted as (i, j). The top leftmost cell is (0, 0). Each cell has a
belt, and all belts are initially facing to the right.Initially, a slime
ball is on the belt of (0, 0), and other belts are empty. Every second,
the state of the conveyor changes as follows: All slime balls on the
conveyor move one cell in the direction of the belt at the same time. If
there is no cell in the moved position, the slime gets out of the
conveyor, and if two slime balls move to the same cell, they merge into
one. All belts with slime ball in the previous second change direction
at the same time: belts facing to the right become facing to the down,
and vice versa. A new slime ball is placed on cell (0, 0). There are q
queries, each being three integers t, x, and y. You have to find out if
there is a slime at the cell (x, y) after t seconds from the start. Can
you do it?
editorial:
SolutionIn the conveyor, cells with same value consists a diagonal ( is
row number, is column number). Letâs call them -th diagonal. So there
are diagonals, from -th to -th.So, we can find every slime ball move to
the next diagonal for every second. It means no two slime ball merge
forever.Given , , , cell belongs to -th diagonal. If , the answer is NO
because there is no slime ball in -th diagonal yet. If , -th diagonal
contains one slime ball, and the ball is placed on cell after seconds
from the start. So slime balls passed this diagonal before.Now, find out
which cell contains slime ball among the diagonal. To do this, we use
following method: simulate with slime balls to check how many slime
reach each cell of the diagonal, and repeat this with slime balls.
Exactly one cell will show different result, and this cell is where -th
slime ball passes through. If this cell is equal to , the answer is YES.
Otherwise the answer is NO.Simulation with slime balls processes as
follows: Place slime balls on cell . Move slime balls to next diagonal.
For each cell, if the cell contains slime balls, moves to right and
moves to down. Repeat the second step. If slime balls reached aimed
diagonal, stop and find the result.
hint: Hint 1 Each second, slime ball moves to next diagonal.
Hint 2 Every slime always locates in different diagonal.
Hint 3 No two slime ball will merge forever.
Hint 4 If , the answer should be "NO".
